The room is great for its price (due to Corona season), however, the manager is awful

First, his message on the listing on Agoda: "We use passcode lock so you needn't stick together when discovering Hanoi" is such a LIE. 
The gate lock is NOT a passcode  lock, it's a combination lock. The door to your room is a lock open by KEY, not a passcode. And there is only one key, so you definitely would need to stick together if you both go out to different direction and don't know when would you be back.

He told me I can leave the key with the lady selling water and drinks at 26 Hang Buom, but can I really trust? I also asked him if she would be always there, he told me I should get her phone no. Alright, I'm a Vietnamese, but what if a foreigner?

And so many other problems, I don't have enough space to write here, but this is an awful manager. You should AVOID at all cost for your best experience. 
I didn't stay the last night (of 3 nights) here.
The hotel has closed, we had to move to another hotel which required to pay extra money

Chung Toi rat gai long o day

We were looking for a place to stay close to city center and this hotel is exactly that: close to the city center, in the middle of a quiet and spacious alleyway, with a small front yard of greenery making very good first impressions.  Other than that:
* Cleanliness: when we first arrived, the toilet needed to be flushed because there was a big bundle of hair still floating around, yuck!
* Hospitality: not very professional, compared to other places that we have been to (for example, Ta Mai Son is similar in both location and service, but the staff is way more friendly and professional). The one staff member that we are most happy with is surprisingly the security man, who consistently greeted and opened doors for guests, making us feel welcomed.
* Facilities: A bit dated, we are most unhappy about the way the mattress is mounted to the bed frame, or rather a lack of it. After one night sleep the mattress has almost slided off!
Malo boutique hotel was great for big family, big room, good breakfast and great service
good experience
